Class Circle

java.lang.Object
Circle
public class Circle extends Object
Represents a circle with a specified radius. This class tracks the number of Circle objects created and provides methods to calculate area, perimeter, and manage the radius.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Circle()
    Constructs a Circle with the default radius of 1.
    Circle(double newRadius)
    Constructs a Circle with a specified radius.

  • Constructor Details

    • Circle

      public Circle()
      Constructs a Circle with the default radius of 1. Increments the number of Circle objects created.

    • Circle

      public Circle(double newRadius)
      Constructs a Circle with a specified radius. Increments the number of Circle objects created.
      Parameters:
      newRadius - the radius of the circle

  • Method Details

    • getArea

      public double getArea()
      Calculates and returns the area of the circle. Area = π * r²
      Returns:
      the area of the circle

    • getPerimeter

      public double getPerimeter()
      Calculates and returns the perimeter (circumference) of the circle. Perimeter = 2 * π * r
      Returns:
      the perimeter of the circle

    • setRadius

      public void setRadius(double newRadius)
      Sets the radius of the circle to the absolute value of the given parameter.
      Parameters:
      newRadius - the new radius value

    • getRadius

      public double getRadius()
      Returns the radius of the circle.
      Returns:
      the radius of the circle

    • instancePrintStuff

      public void instancePrintStuff()
      Demonstrates accessing static variables, static methods, instance methods, and instance variables from an instance method. Prints the number of objects, area, and radius.

    • staticPrintStuff

      public static void staticPrintStuff()
      Demonstrates accessing static variables and static methods from a static method. Note: instance methods and instance variables cannot be accessed in static context. Prints the number of objects.

    • getNumberOfObjects

      public static int getNumberOfObjects()
      Returns the total number of Circle objects created.
      Returns:
      the count of Circle objects
